metadata:
  author: copilot-core
  version: "2.0"
  category: project
---

# Project Bootstrap

Configura o projeto **ap√≥s os submodules j√° estarem adicionados**.

## Fluxo Geral

```
plug (script remoto)  ‚Üí  configure (este skill)
         ‚Üì                        ‚Üì
  adiciona submodules      preenche context/
  copia instructions       inicializa memory/
                           analisa stack
                           cria skills iniciais
```

## Pr√©-condi√ß√£o

Os submodules devem existir em `.github/.copilot-core/` e `.github/.copilot-project/`.

**Se n√£o existirem**, orientar o usu√°rio a rodar o one-liner:

**Windows (PowerShell):**
```
irm https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pdmartins/.copilot-core/main/.github/scripts/plug.ps1 -OutFile plug.ps1; .\plug.ps1; Remove-Item plug.ps1
```

**Linux/Mac:**
```
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pdmartins/.copilot-core/main/.github/scripts/plug.sh | bash
```

Depois o usu√°rio volta ao Chat e diz "configure este projeto".

## Quando Usar

- Submodules j√° est√£o plugados, mas projeto n√£o foi configurado
- Usu√°rio diz "configurar projeto", "setup", "bootstrap", "configurar copilot"
- `context/project.md` ainda est√° com template padr√£o

## Workflow

### 1. Verificar submodules

Verificar se `.github/.copilot-core/` e `.github/.copilot-project/` existem.

- **Se n√£o existirem:** Mostrar one-liner do plug e parar.
- **Se existirem:** Continuar para configura√ß√£o.

### 2. Analisar o projeto

Identificar automaticamente:

- **Stack t√©cnica**: Examinar arquivos como `package.json`, `*.csproj`, `Cargo.toml`, `pyproject.toml`, `go.mod`, `pom.xml`, etc.
- **Frameworks**: React, Next.js, Django, FastAPI, ASP.NET, etc.
- **Ferramentas**: Docker, CI/CD, linters, formatters
- **Estrutura de pastas**: src/, lib/, tests/, etc.

### 3. Coletar informa√ß√µes do usu√°rio

Perguntar de forma conversacional:

1. **Resumo do projeto** ‚Äî "Me descreva brevemente o que este projeto faz"
2. **Fase atual** ‚Äî "Em que fase est√°? (inicial, desenvolvimento, produ√ß√£o)"
3. **Algo espec√≠fico** ‚Äî "Alguma restri√ß√£o ou padr√£o que devo saber?"

### 4. Preencher context/project.md

Combinar an√°lise autom√°tica + respostas do usu√°rio para gerar:

```markdown
# Contexto do Projeto: {nome}

## Status
- **Fase**: {fase}

{"filePath": "d:\Repos\_pm\.copilot-core\.github\scripts\plug.ps1", "content": "<#
.SYNOPSIS
    Adiciona os submodules do Copilot Agent Skills a um projeto.

.DESCRIPTION
    Script m√≠nimo que apenas "pluga" os submodules .copilot-core e .copilot-project
    na pasta .github/ do projeto. N√£o configura nada ‚Äî use o Copilot Chat para isso.

.PARAMETER ProjectName
    Nome do projeto (usado como branch name para .copilot-project).
    Default: nome da pasta atual.

.PARAMETER CoreUrl
    URL do reposit√≥rio .copilot-core.

.PARAMETER ProjectUrl
    URL do reposit√≥rio .copilot-project.

.EXAMPLE
    # One-liner (execu√ß√£o remota)
    irm https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pdmartins/.copilot-core/main/.github/scripts/plug.ps1 -OutFile plug.ps1; .\plug.ps1; Remove-Item plug.ps1

.EXAMPLE
    # Com nome customizado
    .\plug.ps1 -ProjectName "meu-projeto"
#>

[CmdletBinding()]
param(
    [Parameter(Position = 0)]
    [string]$ProjectName,

    [string]$CoreUrl = "https://github.com/pdmartins/.copilot-core.git",
    [string]$ProjectUrl = "https://github.com/pdmartins/.copilot-project.git"
)

$ErrorActionPreference = "Stop"

Write-Host ""
Write-Host "  Copilot Agent Skills - Plug" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""

# --- Pr√©-requisitos ---

if (-not (Get-Command git -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue)) {
    Write-Host "  [X] Git nao encontrado." -ForegroundColor Red
    exit 1
}

if (-not (Test-Path ".git")) {
    Write-Host "  [!] Nao e um repositorio Git. Inicializando..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    git init | Out-Null
}

if (Test-Path ".github/.copilot-core") {
    Write-Host "  [!] Submodules ja existem. Use 'git submodule update --remote' para atualizar." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    exit 0
}

# --- Nome do projeto ---

if ([string]::IsNullOrEmpty($ProjectName)) {
    $ProjectName = Split-Path -Leaf (Get-Location)
}

Write-Host "  Projeto: $ProjectName" -ForegroundColor White

# --- Plug submodules ---

Write-Host "  [1/3] Adicionando .copilot-core..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path ".github" -Force | Out-Null
git submodule add $CoreUrl ".github/.copilot-core" 2>&1 | Out-Null
Write-Host "  [+] .copilot-core ok" -ForegroundColor Green

Write-Host "  [2/3] Adicionando .copilot-project..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
$branchCheck = git ls-remote --heads $ProjectUrl $ProjectName 2>$null
if ($branchCheck) {
    git submodule add -b $ProjectName $ProjectUrl ".github/.copilot-project" 2>&1 | Out-Null
    Write-Host "  [+] .copilot-project ok (branch existente: $ProjectName)" -ForegroundColor Green
} else {
    git submodule add $ProjectUrl ".github/.copilot-project" 2>&1 | Out-Null
    Push-Location ".github/.copilot-project"
    git checkout -b $ProjectName 2>&1 | Out-Null
    Pop-Location
    Write-Host "  [+] .copilot-project ok (branch nova: $ProjectName)" -ForegroundColor Green
}

Write-Host "  [3/3] Copiando instructions..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
$src = ".github/.copilot-core/.github/instructions/workspace.instructions.md"
if (Test-Path $src) {
    New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path ".github/instructions" -Force | Out-Null
    Copy-Item $src ".github/instructions/workspace.instructions.md" -Force
    Write-Host "  [+] workspace.instructions.md copiado" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# --- Resultado ---

Write-Host ""
Write-Host "  Pronto!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "  Proximo passo:" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "    git add . && git commit -m 'feat: add copilot agent'" -ForegroundColor Yellow
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "  Para configurar o projeto, abra o Copilot Chat e diga:" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host '    "configure este projeto"' -ForegroundColor Yellow
Write-Host ""
"}

{"content": "#!/bin/bash
#
# Copilot Agent Skills - Plug
# Adiciona os submodules .copilot-core e .copilot-project ao projeto.
# N√£o configura nada ‚Äî use o Copilot Chat para isso.
#
# One-liner:
#   curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pdmartins/.copilot-core/main/.github/scripts/plug.sh | bash
#
# Com nome customizado:
#   curl -fsSL ... | bash -s -- "meu-projeto"

set -e

CORE_URL="${COPILOT_CORE_URL:-https://github.com/pdmartins/.copilot-core.git}"
PROJECT_URL="${COPILOT_PROJECT_URL:-https://github.com/pdmartins/.copilot-project.git}"
PROJECT_NAME="${1:-$(basename "$(pwd)")}"

G='\033[0;32m' C='\033[0;36m' Y='\033[1;33m' R='\033[0;31m' N='\033[0m'

echo ""
echo -e "  ${C}Copilot Agent Skills - Plug${N}"
echo ""

# --- Pr√©-requisitos ---

if ! command -v git &> /dev/null; then
    echo -e "  ${R}[X] Git nao encontrado.${N}"
    exit 1
fi

if [ ! -d ".git" ]; then
    echo -e "  ${Y}[!] Nao e um repositorio Git. Inicializando...${N}"
    git init > /dev/null 2>&1
fi

if [ -d ".github/.copilot-core" ]; then
    echo -e "  ${Y}[!] Submodules ja existem. Use 'git submodule update --remote' para atualizar.${N}"
    exit 0
fi

echo -e "  Projeto: ${PROJECT_NAME}"

# --- Plug submodules ---

echo -e "  ${C}[1/3] Adicionando .copilot-core...${N}"
mkdir -p ".github"
git submodule add "$CORE_URL" ".github/.copilot-core" > /dev/null 2>&1
echo -e "  ${G}[+] .copilot-core ok${N}"

echo -e "  ${C}[2/3] Adicionando .copilot-project...${N}"
if git ls-remote --heads "$PROJECT_URL" "$PROJECT_NAME" 2>/dev/null | grep -q "$PROJECT_NAME"; then
    git submodule add -b "$PROJECT_NAME" "$PROJECT_URL" ".github/.copilot-project" > /dev/null 2>&1
    echo -e "  ${G}[+] .copilot-project ok (branch existente: ${PROJECT_NAME})${N}"
else
    git submodule add "$PROJECT_URL" ".github/.copilot-project" > /dev/null 2>&1
    pushd ".github/.copilot-project" > /dev/null
    git checkout -b "$PROJECT_NAME" > /dev/null 2>&1
    popd > /dev/null
    echo -e "  ${G}[+] .copilot-project ok (branch nova: ${PROJECT_NAME})${N}"
fi

echo -e "  ${C}[3/3] Copiando instructions...${N}"
src=".github/.copilot-core/.github/instructions/workspace.instructions.md"
if [ -f "$src" ]; then
    mkdir -p ".github/instructions"
    cp "$src" ".github/instructions/workspace.instructions.md"
    echo -e "  ${G}[+] workspace.instructions.md copiado${N}"
fi

# --- Resultado ---

echo ""
echo -e "  ${G}Pronto!${N}"
echo ""
echo -e "  Proximo passo:"
echo -e "    ${Y}git add . && git commit -m 'feat: add copilot agent'${N}"
echo ""
echo -e "  Para configurar o projeto, abra o Copilot Chat e diga:"
echo -e "    ${Y}\"configure este projeto\"${N}"
echo ""
", "filePath": "d:\Repos\_pm\.copilot-core\.github\scripts\plug.sh"}

The user wants to consolidate the plug and setup scripts into a single setup script that does everything. Makes sense ‚Äî the plug script was meant to be minimal, but the setup script already does the same thing plus more. Let me rethink the approach:

1. **One script `setup.ps1`/`setup.sh`** ‚Äî does everything: adds submodules + creates initial structure + copies instructions
2. **Skill `project-bootstrap`** ‚Äî for when submodules already exist but need configuration via Copilot Chat

So the flow becomes:
- **Option A (terminal)**: `setup.ps1` one-liner ‚Äî does everything
- **Option B (Copilot Chat)**: If submodules are already there (e.g., after cloning a repo that has them), say "configure este projeto"

- My plan is to remove the plug scripts entirely and update all references across the bootstrap and init skills to point directly to setup as the primary option, then simplify the quick start guide to just running setup with Copilot Chat as an optional next step.
- I should also verify that the raw URLs referenced in the setup script header are accurate.

# Project Create

Cria e configura um novo projeto **a partir do workspace .copilot-core/.copilot-project**.

## Quando Usar

# Project Init

> üí° **Quer o caminho mais r√°pido?**

> O agente cria tudo e te d√° um script para colar no projeto.

## Quando Usar Este Guia

- N√£o tem acesso ao workspace core
- Ambiente com restri√ß√µes especiais

## Alternativas Recomendadas

## Clonando em Nova M√°quina

Se voc√™ clonar um projeto que j√° tem os submodules:

```bash

cd projeto

### "submodule already exists"
Remova e refa√ßa

toolCalls.name: create_file
toolCalls.arguments:
{"content": "name: Sync Core Branch

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
    paths:
      - 'instructions/**'
      - 'skills/**'
      - 'templates/**'

jobs:
  sync:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: write

    steps:
      - name: Checkout main
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Sync to core branch
        run: |
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"

          # Create or switch to core branch
          if git ls-remote --heads origin core | grep -q core; then
            git checkout core
            # Remove all tracked files
            git rm -rf . 2>/dev/null || true
          else
            git checkout --orphan core
            git rm -rf . 2>/dev/null || true
          fi

          # Bring only the needed folders from main
          git checkout main -- instructions/
          git checkout main -- skills/
          git checkout main -- templates/

          # Commit and push
          git add -A
          if git diff --cached --quiet; then
            echo "No changes to sync."
          else
            git commit -m "sync: update core branch from main"
            git push origin core --force
            echo "Core branch updated."
          fi
", "filePath": "d:\Repos\_pm\.copilot-core\.github\workflows\sync-core.yml"}

When the branch `core` is created, it will have:
```
instructions/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ default.instructions.md
skills/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ (all skills)
templates/
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ workspace.instructions.md
```

So the path in the project-create script changes from:
```
copy .github\.copilot-core\.github\instructions\workspace.instructions.md .github\instructions\


```

to:
```
copy .github\.copilot-core\templates\workspace.instructions.md .github\instructions\
```

I need to create the template file at the repo root, set up a GitHub Action that triggers on pushes to main to manage the core branch, and update all skill references to use the new path.

For the workflow, I'm thinking through how to cleanly sync only the instructions, skills, and templates directories to the core branch‚ÄîI could check out main, copy those specific directories to a temporary location, then switch to the core branch and replace its contents before force-pushing, or I could use git worktree for a cleaner approach. I'll go with the straightforward method of checking out main, isolating the needed files, and then syncing them to core.

Now I need to figure out which skills should actually live in the core branch‚Äîsome like `project-create` are only used from the dev workspace itself, while others like the agent-memory and project-context skills are meant to be called from target projects, so I should probably exclude the dev-only ones from the core distribution. I'll include all skills for now and refine later if needed. Next, I need to create the workspace instructions template, set up the sync workflow, update the project-create skill to reference the correct path, and verify there aren't other places pointing to the old instructions location.

<analysis>
**Chronological Review:**

1. **Phase 1 - Initial Question**: User asked how to add gitmodules (.copilot-core and .copilot-project) to a new or existing project. Agent read SKILL.md files and provided manual step-by-step instructions.

2. **Phase 2 - Simplification Request**: User wanted a simpler way to "plug" submodules and a separate way to "configure" the project. Agent created `plug.ps1` and `plug.sh` scripts, updated `project-bootstrap` to focus on configuration, updated `QUICK-START.md` and `project-init`.

3. **Phase 3 - Consolidation (plug ‚Üí setup)**: User said instead of having both plug and setup scripts, just have one setup script. Agent removed plug scripts, updated all references to point to setup.ps1/setup.sh as the single entry point.

4. **Phase 4 - Flow Simulation**: User asked to imagine the flow for a new project (docker-framework). Agent walked through the complete flow.

5. **Phase 5 - project-create Skill**: User proposed a new approach: instead of running a script, use Copilot Chat in the .copilot-core workspace to create a project. The agent would ask questions, create a branch in .copilot-project, and provide a script/one-liner. Agent created `project-create` skill, updated bootstrap, init, QUICK-START, workspace instructions, and default instructions.

6. **Phase 6 - Remove setup scripts entirely**: User said to remove the setup scripts (Option B) and keep only the project-create flow (Option A), with multi-line scripts instead of one-liners. Agent deleted setup.ps1, setup.sh, removed the .github/scripts/ folder entirely, updated all skills and docs.

7. **Phase 7 - Branch separation (current)**: User noticed that when .copilot-core is cloned as submodule, the `.github/` folder comes along (containing dev docs, workspace instructions, etc.). User wants a `core` branch that only has the files projects need, while `main` keeps everything. Agent began implementing this.

**Intent Mapping:**
- User wants the cleanest possible onboarding experience for new projects
- User wants separation of development files from distribution files in .copilot-core
- User chose `core` as the branch name for the clean distribution version
- The single entry point is `project-create` skill from the .copilot-core workspace

**Technical Inventory:**
- Git submodules pattern: .copilot-core (branch: core) + .copilot-project (branch: per-project)
- Agent Skills pattern (agentskills.io)
- GitHub Actions for branch synchronization
- Two repos: pdmartins/.copilot-core and pdmartins/.copilot-project

metadata:
  author: copilot-core
  version: "3.0"
  category: project
---

# Project Create

Cria e configura um novo projeto **completo** a partir do workspace .copilot-core/.copilot-project.

> **üí° Usar com Plan mode** ‚Äî Este skill envolve muitas decis√µes (skills a criar, contexto a preencher, estrutura). O Plan mode permite que o usu√°rio revise tudo antes de executar.

## Quando Usar

- Usu√°rio est√° neste workspace e quer preparar um novo projeto
- Diz "criar projeto", "novo projeto", "onboard projeto X"
- Quer que branch, contexto, skills e mem√≥ria j√° estejam prontos antes de plugar

## Fluxo

```
Workspace .copilot-core                    Projeto-alvo
         ‚Üì                                      ‚Üì
1. Coletar contexto profundo               7. Colar script
2. Definir skills espec√≠ficos              8. git add && commit
3. Criar branch no .copilot-project        ‚Üí Pronto!
4. Preencher context/project.md
5. Criar skills do projeto
6. Gerar script
```

## Workflow

### 1. Coletar contexto profundo

Entrevista conversacional **aprofundada**. N√£o pular etapas ‚Äî quanto mais contexto, melhor o agente funciona no projeto-alvo.

**Identidade do projeto:**
1. **Nome** ‚Äî ser√° o nome da branch (sugerir kebab-case)
2. **Resumo** ‚Äî o que o projeto faz, para quem, qual problema resolve
3. **Fase atual** ‚Äî inicial, ativo, manuten√ß√£o, legado

**Stack e arquitetura:**
4. **Linguagens** ‚Äî principal + secund√°rias
5. **Frameworks** ‚Äî web, backend, mobile, etc.
6. **Banco de dados** ‚Äî tipo e tecnologia
7. **Infra** ‚Äî Docker, K8s, cloud provider, CI/CD
8. **Arquitetura** ‚Äî monolito, microservi√ßos, serverless, monorepo
9. **Estrutura principal** ‚Äî pastas-chave (src/, apps/, packages/)

**Padr√µes e conven√ß√µes:**
10. **Code style** ‚Äî linters, formatters, naming conventions
11. **Git flow** ‚Äî trunk-based, gitflow, branch naming
12. **Testes** ‚Äî unit, integration, e2e, cobertura esperada
13. **Documenta√ß√£o** ‚Äî onde, formato, idioma

**Dom√≠nio e regras:**
14. **Dom√≠nio** ‚Äî termos espec√≠ficos do neg√≥cio que o agente deve conhecer
15. **Restri√ß√µes** ‚Äî seguran√ßa, compliance, performance, acessibilidade
16. **Integra√ß√µes** ‚Äî APIs externas, servi√ßos de terceiros

> **Nota:** Adaptar as perguntas ao contexto. Se o usu√°rio diz "√© um CLI em Go", n√£o perguntar sobre banco de dados. Ser inteligente sobre o que √© relevante.

### 2. Definir skills espec√≠ficos

Com base nas respostas, **propor skills** para o `.copilot-project/skills/`:

**Cat√°logo de skills comuns por stack:**

| Stack | Skills sugeridos |
|-------|-----------------|
| Frontend (React, Vue, etc.) | `component-create`, `style-guide`, `state-management` |
| Backend API (Node, .NET, etc.) | `api-endpoint`, `db-migration`, `error-handling` |
| Mobile (React Native, Flutter) | `screen-create`, `navigation-pattern` |
| CLI | `command-create`, `cli-testing` |
| Infra/DevOps | `dockerfile-guide`, `pipeline-create`, `deploy-checklist` |
| Monorepo | `package-create`, `cross-package-rules` |
| Full-stack | Combinar frontend + backend acima |

**Para cada skill proposto, definir:**
- Nome (formato `{contexto}-{funcionalidade}`)
- Descri√ß√£o (o que faz + triggers)
- Conte√∫do principal (workflow, templates, regras)

**Sempre incluir pelo menos:**
- 1 skill de padr√£o de c√≥digo (coding conventions do projeto)
- Skills adicionais conforme stack detectada

> **Apresentar ao usu√°rio a lista de skills propostos para aprova√ß√£o antes de criar.** No Plan mode, isso acontece naturalmente.

### 3. Verificar se branch j√° existe

No `.copilot-project/`:

```bash
git branch --list {nome-projeto}
git ls-remote --heads origin {nome-projeto}
```

- **Se existir**: Avisar e perguntar se deseja sobrescrever
- **Se n√£o existir**: Continuar

### 4. Criar branch no .copilot-project

```bash
cd .copilot-project
git checkout main
git pull origin main
git checkout -b {nome-projeto}
```

### 5. Preencher context/project.md

Gerar com as informa√ß√µes coletadas ‚Äî **documento rico**, n√£o template gen√©rico:

```markdown
# Contexto do Projeto: {nome}

## Status
- **Fase**: {fase}
- **√öltima atualiza√ß√£o**: {data}

## Resumo

{resumo detalhado ‚Äî 2-3 par√°grafos com prop√≥sito, p√∫blico e problema que resolve}

## Stack

- **Linguagem**: {principal} + {secund√°rias}
- **Framework**: {framework(s)}
- **Banco de dados**: {tipo + tecnologia}
- **Infra**: {Docker, CI/CD, cloud}
- **Build/Tooling**: {bundler, package manager, linters}

## Arquitetura

{descri√ß√£o da arquitetura ‚Äî monolito/microservi√ßos/etc.}

### Estrutura de Pastas

```
{estrutura principal do projeto}
```

### Componentes Principais

| Componente | Responsabilidade |
|------------|-----------------|
| {nome} | {o que faz} |

## Padr√µes e Conven√ß√µes

### Code Style
{naming, formata√ß√£o, regras de lint}

### Git
{branch naming, commit messages, flow}

### Testes
{estrat√©gia, ferramentas, cobertura esperada}

## Dom√≠nio

### Gloss√°rio

| Termo | Significado |
|-------|-------------|
| {termo} | {defini√ß√£o} |

### Regras de Neg√≥cio

{regras importantes que o agente deve respeitar}

## Restri√ß√µes

{seguran√ßa, compliance, performance, acessibilidade}

## Integra√ß√µes

| Servi√ßo | Prop√≥sito | Docs |
|---------|-----------|------|
| {nome} | {para que} | {link} |

## Pr√≥ximos Passos

- [ ] Plugar submodules no projeto (script abaixo)
- [ ] Verificar skills criados e ajustar conforme necess√°rio
- [ ] Executar `project-analyze` no projeto-alvo para refinamento
```

> **Nota:** Preencher apenas as se√ß√µes relevantes. N√£o for√ßar se√ß√µes vazias. Se o projeto n√£o tem banco de dados, omitir. Se n√£o tem integra√ß√µes, omitir.

### 6. Criar skills do projeto

Para cada skill aprovado na etapa 2:

1. Criar diret√≥rio em `.copilot-project/skills/{nome}/`
2. Criar `SKILL.md` seguindo o padr√£o Agent Skills:

```markdown
---
name: {contexto}-{funcionalidade}
description: {descri√ß√£o clara + triggers}
metadata:
  author: {nome-projeto}
  version: "1.0"
  category: {categoria}
---

# {Nome do Skill}

{conte√∫do: workflow, templates, regras, exemplos}
```

**Regras para skills de projeto:**
- Ser **espec√≠fico** ‚Äî referenciar nomes reais de pastas, libs, padr√µes do projeto
- Incluir **exemplos** com o stack real do projeto
- Definir **triggers** claros para quando o skill deve ativar

### 7. Inicializar memory/lessons-learned.md

```markdown
# Li√ß√µes Aprendidas - {nome}

## Sobre este arquivo

Este arquivo registra li√ß√µes aprendidas durante o desenvolvimento do projeto.
O Copilot Agent consulta e atualiza este arquivo automaticamente.

---

## Li√ß√µes

> Nenhuma li√ß√£o registrada ainda.
```

### 8. Commit e push

```bash
cd .copilot-project   # (se n√£o estiver j√°)
git add .
git commit -m "feat: configura√ß√£o inicial do projeto {nome}"
git push -u origin {nome-projeto}
```

Voltar para branch anterior:
```bash
git checkout main
```

### 9. Gerar script para o projeto-alvo

Gerar os comandos para o usu√°rio colar no terminal do projeto-alvo.
Sempre fornecer **ambas as vers√µes** (PowerShell e Bash).

**Windows (PowerShell):**
```powershell
# Copilot Agent Skills - Setup
mkdir .github\instructions -Force
git submodule add -b core https://github.com/pdmartins/.copilot-core.git .github/.copilot-core
git submodule add -b {nome-projeto} https://github.com/pdmartins/.copilot-project.git .github/.copilot-project
copy .github\.copilot-core\templates\workspace.instructions.md .github\instructions\
git add .
git commit -m "feat: add copilot agent"
```

**Linux/Mac (Bash):**
```bash
# Copilot Agent Skills - Setup
mkdir -p .github/instructions
git submodule add -b core https://github.com/pdmartins/.copilot-core.git .github/.copilot-core
git submodule add -b {nome-projeto} https://github.com/pdmartins/.copilot-project.git .github/.copilot-project
cp .github/.copilot-core/templates/workspace.instructions.md .github/instructions/
git add .
git commit -m "feat: add copilot agent"
```

### 10. Output final

```
‚úÖ Projeto "{nome}" criado!

üìã Branch: {nome-projeto}
üìÅ Contexto: .copilot-project/context/project.md
üß† Mem√≥ria: .copilot-project/memory/lessons-learned.md
üîß Skills: {lista de skills criados}

Para plugar no projeto, rode na raiz dele:
```

(incluir os scripts PowerShell e Bash acima)

## Notas

- **Usar Plan mode** ‚Äî permite revisar contexto, skills e estrutura antes de executar
- Este skill opera **neste workspace** (.copilot-core + .copilot-project), n√£o no projeto-alvo
- O script assume que o projeto-alvo tem Git inicializado
- Se o usu√°rio n√£o tiver acesso push ao `.copilot-project`, ele n√£o poder√° criar a branch remotamente
- Ap√≥s plugar no projeto-alvo, rodar `project-analyze` para refinar com base no c√≥digo real

## Refer√™ncia

| M√©todo | Onde roda | O que faz |
|--------|-----------|-----------|
| **project-create** | Workspace core (Plan) | Cria branch + contexto + skills + script |
| **project-bootstrap** | Projeto-alvo (Agent) | Configura/atualiza contexto ap√≥s submodules

| **Plan** | Tarefas complexas que precisam de revis√£o ‚Äî `project-create`, refatora√ß√µes grandes, an√°lises de arquitetura |

response.value:
The user wants to know if we can adjust the prompts so that if the user is NOT in Plan mode when triggering `project-create`, the agent asks them to switch to Plan mode.

The reality is: the Copilot Chat agent doesn't have a way to programmatically detect which mode it's running in (Agent vs Plan). There's no API or environment variable for that. The agent just receives the prompt and executes.

However, we CAN add a strong instruction in the skill that tells the agent to:
1. Ask the user if they're in Plan mode before proceeding
2. If not, recommend switching

This is a prompt-level solution - the agent will follow the instruction to ask. It won't be automatic detection, but it achieves the goal.


I'll add this check as the first step in the project-create skill workflow, so the agent prompts the user about Plan mode before doing anything else.
